alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 11:48AM EDT until August 11 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Floodwaters inundate very lowest lying business parking lots off Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 29.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Thursday was 29.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 600 AM EDT.
